meanings.definition: To consign or assign to an inferior position or rank.
meanings.sent1: The teacher was relegating the student to the back of the classroom for misbehaving.
meanings.sent2: The manager was relegating the new employee to a lower role until they gained more experience.
meanings.sent3: The cat was relegating the toy mouse to the corner, pretending it was a real prey.
meanings.sent4: The storm was relegating the once mighty tree to a mere pile of branches on the ground.
meanings.sent5: The judge's decision of relegating the criminal to a life sentence was final and severe.

meanings.definition: To transfer to a less important position or category.
meanings.sent1: The company was relegating the outdated technology to storage to make room for new equipment.
meanings.sent2: The coach was relegating the star player to the bench due to poor performance.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was relegating the acorn to a hidden spot for safekeeping.
meanings.sent4: The artist was relegating the color red to the background to make the blue stand out more.
meanings.sent5: The librarian was relegating the old books to a separate section for historical reference.
